io.confluent.ksql.function.udf

Annotation Type Udf


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Udf
    The Udf annotation on a method tells KSQL that this method should be exposed as a user-defined function in KSQL. The enclosing class must also be annotated with UdfDescription.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static java.lang.String NO_SCHEMA 
      static java.lang.String NO_SCHEMA_PROVIDER 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String description
      The function description.
      java.lang.String schema
      The schema for the return value of the UDF.
      java.lang.String schemaProvider
      The name of the method that provides the return type of the UDF.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_SCHEMA

        public static final java.lang.String NO_SCHEMA

      • NO_SCHEMA_PROVIDER

        public static final java.lang.String NO_SCHEMA_PROVIDER

    • Element Detail

      • description

        public abstract java.lang.String description
        The function description.

        Useful where there are multiple overloaded versions of a function. This text is displayed when the user calls DESCRIBE FUNCTION ....

        Returns:
        the text to display to the user.
        Default:
        ""

      • schema

        public abstract java.lang.String schema
        The schema for the return value of the UDF.

        For simple method signatures, this is optional and can be determined from the return value itself. For complex return types (e.g. Struct types), this is required and will fail if not supplied.

        Default:
        ""

      • schemaProvider

        public abstract java.lang.String schemaProvider
        The name of the method that provides the return type of the UDF.
        Returns:
        the name of the other method
        Default:
        ""
